bioghist.p: Aliki Liacouras Brandenberg (b. 1929) is an author and illustrator of books for children. Aliki graduated from the Philadelphia Museum School of Art in 1951. Before she began writing books for children, Aliki worked as a freelance artist, creating art for advertising and display purposes. She also taught classes in art, worked as a muralist, and started a greeting card company. Her first book, The Story of William Tell, was published in 1960. Over her career, she has written many books and illustrated the books of other authors, including her husband Franz Brandenberg.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of sketches, illustrations, dummies, color separations and pasteups for This is the House Where Jack Lives, My Five Senses, Birds at Night, Averages, and The Story of William Penn.
